content:
To reset the primary password, Go to tools>Developertools>error console - enter this text 

   openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")

- the Reset button should appear. All passwords for accounts will be deleted
creator: davidsk

content: This technique works for me in Windows: - click 'new message' and drag window to wherever desired and then cancel - Windows remembers the setting for next times you click 'new message'
creator: davidsk

content: It may be that something is preventing the prefs.js file from updating. Anti-virus?

content: The technique I have used is this: - export a csv from thunderbird, even if just one email address in the addressbook. Use this as a template - use a spreadsheet program to load the comcast csv and mirror the column settings of the thunderbird csv - the import should then go smoothly
creator: davidsk

content: Just a suggestion: unzip the file and view in File Manager to see if the files are there. POP would be in the Mail folder and IMAP in the Imapmail folder. If there, you might try tools>import>import from another thunderbirdinstallation>choose a profile folder. That would bring in the missing folders. OR, you could exit Thunderbird and use File Manager to copy the profile directly to overlay the existing profile. The existing profile can be located by help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' and then exit Thunderbird. At that point you would be in the profile.
creator: davidsk

content: Outlook comes in several flavors. I use a simple one from outlook.com. If that is your intent, here the settings I use: INCOMING: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (This is IMAP) OUTGOING: smtp.office.365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
creator: davidsk
